ack.title: ACKNOWLEDGMENTS
ack.p: We thank Sarah Hill, Darlan Cândido Da Silva, Jayna Raghwani, and Louis du Plessis for their input on the phylogenetic analyses presented here and Sully Márquez for her work on the detection of OROV in the Ecuadorian samples.

The work leading to the generation of the sequences from these samples was funded by Public Health England as part of a PHE-funded Ph.D. studentship awarded to E.L.W., C.H.L., and S.T.P. and by the Universidad San Francisco de Quito. This study was supported by the Medical Research Council (MR/L009528/1 to T.A.B.) and by a FAPESP-MRC grant (CADDE, FAPESP 2018/14389-0 to N.R.F.). The Wellcome Centre for Human Genetics is supported by grant 203141/Z/16/Z. M.E.-Z. is supported by an EMBO Long Term Fellowship (ALTF376-2017) and a Leverhulme Trust ECR Fellowship (ECF-2019-542). B.G. is supported by the 2017 Universities of Academic Excellence Scholarship Program of the Secretariat for Higher Education, Science, Technology, and Innovation of the Republic of Ecuador (ARSEQ-BEC-003163-2017) and by Universidad San Francisco de Quito. M.R.T.N. is supported by CNPq (National Council for Scientific and Technological Development) grant 302584/20115-3. N.R.F. is supported by a Wellcome Trust and Royal Society Sir Henry Dale Fellowship (grant 204311/Z/16/Z). O.G.P. is supported by the European Union Seventh Framework Program (FP7/2007–2013)/European Research Council (614725-PATHPHYLODYN).
